item.title: Anton add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Anton add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Anton add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My bounty is as boundless as the sea, My love as deep; the more I give to thee, The more I have, for both are infinite." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Anton add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Anton add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Me, poor man, my library Was dukedom large enough." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Anton add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: Anton add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "My art and profession is to live." -- Montaigne

item.title: Anton add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "It is a small soul, buried beneath the weight of affairs, that does not know how to get clean away from them, that cannot put them aside and pick them up again." -- Montaigne

item.title: Anton add a quote by Ernst Cassirer
item.description: "Man is always inclined to regard the small circle in which he lives as the center of the world and to make his particular, private life the standard of the universe and to make his particular, private life the standard of the universe. But he must give up this vain pretense, this petty provincial way of thinking and judging." -- Ernst Cassirer

item.title: Anton add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Anton add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Instead of clearing his own heart the zealot tries to clear the world." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Anton add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life is like arriving late for a movie, having to figure out what was going on without bothering everybody with a lot of questions, and then being unexpectedly called away before you find out how it ends." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Anton add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "Men never do evil so completely and cheerfully as when they do it from religious conviction." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Anton add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "It is man's natural sickness to believe that he possesses the truth." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Anton add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Anton add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "By space the universe encompasses me and swallows me up like an atom; by thought I comprehend the world." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Anton add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Show me a sane man and I will cure him for you." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Anton add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Anton add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Whatever is rejected from the self, appears in the world as an event." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Anton add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The pendulum of the mind oscillates between sense and nonsense, not between right and wrong." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Anton add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Anton add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The creation of something new is not accomplished by the intellect but by the play instinct acting from inner necessity. The creative mind plays with the objects it loves. " -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Anton add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "When men stop believing in God, it isn't that they then believe in nothing: they believe in everything." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Anton add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Thus I rediscovered what writers have always known (and have told us again and again): books always speak of other books, and every story tells a story that has already been told." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Anton add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Anton add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Happiness is beneficial for the body, but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Anton add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "It comes so soon, the moment when there is nothing left to wait for." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Anton add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "The beginning of love is to let those we love be perfectly themselves and not to twist them to fit our own image." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Anton add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "Love seeks one thing only: the good of the one loved. It leaves all the other secondary effects to take care of themselves. Love, therefore, is its own reward." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Anton add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
